summary: In this context, nitrate is mentioned as a measure of nitric oxide production, which is relevant to the inflammatory response mediated by interleukin-1 (IL-1). The study investigates the effects of IL-1 on neutrophil activation and cytokine levels, including interleukin-8 (IL-8). While nitrate levels are measured, there is no direct discussion of interleukin-8 receptor binding activity or its relationship with nitrate, indicating a more indirect connection through the inflammatory process rather than a direct interaction.
